author: Special Correspondent
text:
In a raid conducted late on Friday, the Customs Department seized four kg of amphetamines allegedly being smuggled in a consignment of bicycle seats through an Andheri-based courier agency. The manager of the agency, Edward Roderigues, was arrested while the proprietor is on the run, officials said.

Customs officials said the raids were conducted by the Special Investigation and Intelligence Branch (SIIB) of the department's airport special cargo section. “We had a tip-off that a consignment of cycle seats to be sent by air through a courier company actually contained drugs. We conducted a raid on Friday night at the office of Total Courier and Cargo Services at Koldongri, Andheri (East), and found 4.07 kg of amphetamines in packets, hidden in the seats’ hollow spaces,” a Customs officer said.

He added that the street value of the seized narcotics in India was Rs 40.7 lakh. “It is too early to say who sent the consignment and where it was headed,” he said.

Roderigues was produced in court on Saturday and remanded in judicial custody for 14 days. A search is on for the proprietor of the courier firm.
title: Customs seize 4 kg of drugs from courier firm
